3869.name: Sir Galahad's Suite
description: Galahad's room is decorated all in silver.  There are silver
vases, silver tables, even the bedposts are silver.  Such an
honor is only bestowed on one of King Arthur's most revered
servant...and friend.
Back into the Hallway of Honor.

3887.name: Royal Corridor
description: This hallway is lined with murals depicting the achievements of
the famous King Arthur and his troops.  On either side of you
there are lifelike statues of armored knights.  These are the
suits of armor worn by the famous Knights of the Round
Table.
Down the Royal Corridor.
Down the Royal Corridor.

3811.name: Western Wing of Camelot
description: The hallway continues on here.  The walls here are decorated
with beautiful paintings and the corridor is adorned with
several priceless artifacts.  Further ahead, you can see a
guard stoically patrolling the area.
Down the western corridor.
Towards the center of Camelot's Main Level.

3883.name: Curve in Royal Corridor
description: Here the corridor branches and continues either east or south.
Travelling east will take you back towards the stairway down
and out of Camelot.  To the south lies another long hallway,
and, perhaps, the Inner Chambers of King Arthur.  A door lies
to the west.
Down the Royal Corridor.
The entrance to a small room.
Back towards the stairwell.

3809.name: Corridor in Camelot
description: You can hear the hum of activity from all directions.  It
appears to be dinner time, for the servants are hurrying about
their duties.  Ahead, you notice that the hallway opens into a
sort of junction.
A corridor in Camelot.
A corridor in Camelot.

3833.name: Passageway through the dungeon
description: You are in a dark, damp part of the castle--one many never
see.  The stench is unbelievable, and your stomach turns at the
sight of decayed rats on the floor.  It's hard to believe that
this place is part of the same grand castle only a short few
steps away. Cell doors are to the north and south.
A small cell.
A small cell.
Passageway through the dungeon.
Back towards the stairs up.

3823.name: Down the Small Hallway
description: This small foyer holds a large suit of armor and an elegant
painting at the wall.  To the east, a doorway leads into the guard's
room.

3890.name: End of the Royal Corridor
description: You've reached the end of the Royal Corridor.  A pair of gold
double doors lies before you to the north.  They seem to almost
glow as you approach them.
Into a large room.
Down the Royal Corridor.

3873.name: Chef's Lounge
description: You've entered a lounge for the chefs.  Here, the royal cooks
can relax and rest after cleaning the exquisite utensils King
Arthur uses.
Back into the Hallway of Honor.
Down to the kitchen.

3818.name: Guards' Room
description: You have entered the guards' room. The room is a place where
the guards congregate to discuss the day's activities, which
guard patrols which area, etc.  Over to the left, you see a
pile of old, used armor lying on the floor.
To the Eastern Corridor.

3804.name: Edge of the Moat
description: Ahead of you lies the wondrous castle of Camelot.  A large moat
lies between you and the building, however.  It would seem King
Arthur was not expecting guests, for the drawbridge has been
raised.
Pathway to the moat.
A walkway through the courtyard.

3859.name: Hallway of Honor
description: The hallway here has a golden glow about it.  You realize that
the floor is plated with gold here, and a small coffee table
next to you has a gorgeous silver sheen to it.  Above you hangs
an enormous chandelier swing gently.
Entrance to a suite.
Back toward the junction.

3871.name: Guest's Quarters
description: Though this room is by no means superbly furnished, it is
equipped with all the amenities one could ever need.  The bed
is covered with a beautiful, knitted comforter.  You can only
wonder how much effort must go into making such a fine quality
item.
Back into the Hallway of Honor.

3852.name: Short Hallway
description: The hallway here is adorned with beautiful paintings of those
who ruled the surrounding lands before King Arthur.  Like him,
each of these men have the air of importance and royalty about
them.  The pieces of artwork are supported by finely crafted
brass frames.
Down the short hallway.
Towards the main stairwell.

3881.name: Royal Corridor
description: This hallway is lined with murals depicting the achievements of
the famous King Arthur and his troops.  On either side of you
there are lifelike statues of former rulers of this land.
Down the Royal Corridor.
Back to the stairwell.

3840.name: Small Dungeon Cell
description: This cell seems almost burrowed into the stone, much like a
small cave.  The darkness makes it very difficult to see
anything in detail, though you can make out small shapes on the
ground.  Soft screaching sounds echo all around you, and you
can see small figures running about the dungeon floor.
Back into the hallway.

3865.name: Servant's Quarters
description: This room is small!  You wonder how a person could live here at
all.  In fact, you are quite sure that this is even smaller
than you cousins dormitory room at college!  A small twin bed
sits in one corner.  The sheets look as if they haven't been
washed in ages.
Return to hallway.

3891.name: Royal Ante-Chamber
description: Here is where King Arthur does all of his work.  A beautiful
oak desk sits at the east end of the room overlooking the
wondrous scenery of Camelot's Courtyard.  A giant mirror lies
directly in front of you, reflecting the image of a worn
adventurer.  The only exit appears to be at the south of the room.
A giant mirror.
Back into the Royal Corridor.

3815.name: Eastern Corridor
description: You are in the eastern corridor now.  The hallway continues on
here.  The walls here are decorated with beautiful paintings
and the corridor is adorned with several priceless artifacts.
Further ahead, you can see a guard stoically patrolling the
area.  To the south, you see a closed door.  There are loud
noises coming from behind it; you can barely make out the
sounds of pots and pans clanking together.
Into the kitchen.
Down the Eastern Corridor.

3819.name: Northern Corridor
description: This hallway is littered with proof of the victories of
Arthur's men.  Beautiful swords, vases, and other artifacts
line the corridor.  On each side of you, tall candles in gold candleholders
provide light for the hallway.
Further down the Northern Corridor.
To the center of this level.

3861.name: Hallway to the Servant Quarters
description: This hallway is noticable less well decorated, and seems
designed only for ease of use.  To the south, you can see the
entrances to three servant rooms.
Back towards the junction.
Towards the servant quarters.

3867.name: Hallway of Honor
description: The hallway continues here towards the guest quarters and the
room of Sir Galahad, as well as back towards the Long
Corridor.  In addition, there are entrances to rooms both north
and south of you.
Into a small room.
Into a Guest's Quarters.
Back towards the junction.

3830.name: Camelot's Dungeon
description: You've entered the lowest level of Camelot.  The dungeon is
dimly lit and a vile stench radiates from the west.  You can
hear the moans of prisoners as they suffer here, waiting to
die.
Passageway through the dungeon.
Main Stairwell up to Ground Level.

3821.name: East Corridor
description: A small corridor leads to the east.  At the end is the main
stairwell.  On either side are panels, almost reminiscent of doors,
and many elegant tapestries hang along the hallway.
Down the small sideway.

3868.name: End of the Hallway of Honor
description: The end of the Hallway of Honor leads to Sir Galahad's private
room.  Also, to the north, there is a small doorway leading
into another guest room.  The door to Sir Galahad's room seems
to be made of finely crafted stone; you wonder if you even have
the strength to open it.
Into another guest's room.
Into Sir Galahad's room.

3836.name: Small Dungeon Cell
description: This cell seems almost burrowed into the stone, much like a
small cave.  The darkness makes it very difficult to see
anything in detail, though you can make out small shapes on the
ground.  Soft screaching sounds echo all around you, and you
can see small figures running about the dungeon floor.
Back into the hallway.

3832.name: Passageway through the dungeon
description: You are in a dark, damp part of the castle--one many never
see.  The stench is unbelievable, and your stomach turns at the
sight of decayed rats on the floor.  It's hard to believe that
this place is part of the same grand castle only a short few
steps away.  Cell doors are to the north and south.
A small cell.
A small cell.
Passageway through the dungeon.
Back towards the stairs up.

3886.name: Royal Corridor
description: This hallway is lined with murals depicting the achievements of
the famous King Arthur and his troops.  On either side of you
there are lifelike statues of armored knights.  These are the
suits of armor worn by the famous Knights of the Round
Table.
Down the Royal Corridor.
Down the Royal Corridor.

3802.name: Beautiful Courtyard
description: You enter the spacious courtyard of Camelot.  It is here that
the legendary King Arthur makes his residence and rules the
surrounding land.  With the aid of the honorable Knights of the
Round Table to assist him, he has made his people happy,
prosperous, and safe from enemies.  The courtyard is decorated
with beautiful fountains and the walkway is made of the finest
stone.

3820.name: Northern Corridor
description: This hallway is littered with proof of the victories of
Arthur's men.  Beautiful swords, vases, and other artifacts
line the corridor.  On each side of you, gold candleholders
provide light for the hallway.
Towards the center of this level.

3856.name: Long Corridor
description: This long hallway leads down towards the guest quarters, as
well as the rooms the servants use.  The walls are adorned with
beautiful tapestries, donated but the wealthiest families
around.  All of them have pledged their allegiance to King Arthur.
Towards Lancelot's Suite.
Down the long corridor.

3824.name: Main Stairwell
description: This is the main stairwell.  It leads up to the second level of
Camelot, as well as down to the dungeon.  You hear screams of
agony from below.  From above, you hear only the sound of armor
clanking as someone paces back and forth.
Up to the Second Level of Camelot.
Down into the Dungeon.

3834.name: End of the Dungeon
description: You've finally reached the end of this dark, stench ridden
pathway.  There don't seem to be any exits here, though, save
the return to the stairway to your east.
Return to the sairway.

3837.name: Small Dungeon Cell
description: This cell seems almost burrowed into the stone, much like a
small cave.  The darkness makes it very difficult to see
anything in detail, though you can make out small shapes on the
ground.  Soft screaching sounds echo all around you, and you
can see small figures running about the dungeon floor.
Back into the hallway.

3882.name: Royal Corridor
description: This hallway is lined with murals depicting the achievements of
the famous King Arthur and his troops.  On either side of you
there are lifelike statues of former rulers of this land.
Down the Royal Corridor.
Back to the stairwell.

3857.name: Long Corridor
description: This long hallway leads down towards the guest quarters, as
well as the rooms the servants use.  The walls are adorned with
beautiful tapestries, donated but the wealthiest families
around.  All of them have pledged their allegiance to King Arthur.
Towards Lancelot's Suite.
Down the long corridor.

3831.name: Passageway through the dungeon
description: You are in a dark, damp part of the castle--one many never
see.  The stench is unbelievable, and your stomach turns at the
sight of decayed rats on the floor.  It's hard to believe that
this place is part of the same grand castle only a short few steps away.
Cell doors are to the north and south.
A small cell.
A small cell.
Passageway through the dungeon.
Back towards the stairs up.

3864.name: Servant's Quarters
description: This room is small!  You wonder how a person could live here at
all.  In fact, you are quite sure that this is even smaller
than you cousins dormitory room at college!  A small twin bed
sits in one corner.  The sheets look as if they haven't been
washed in ages.
Return to hallway.

3806.name: Near the Castle Gate
description: You finally manage to get past that pesky moat.  Up ahead to
the north you can see the beautiful castle of Camelot.  A short
bit further and you will pass under the large gate that keeps
King Arthur's enemies out of the castle.
Walkway to the castle gate.
Pathway to the moat.

3884.name: Merlin's Laboratory
description: As you enter the room, you wince at the terrible odor wafting
throughout the area.  A green haze floats lazily in the center
of the room here making it difficult to see.  The young
enchanter Merlin stands before you working behind a counter.
There are several beakers and assorted other bits of equipment
used to create chemicals on the countertop.
Exit of Merlin's Lab.

3805.name: Moat around Camelot
description: You are above the first line of protection for the castle.  As
you look below, you can see numerous small fish swimming about
furiously.  As you ponder what type of creature they might be,
a small bird sitting by the edge of the moat decides to get a
drink.  Moments after it begins to drink, one fish lunges at
the bird, grabs it, and drags the floundering animal into the
moat.  There, the others hungrily devour it.
Walkway to the castle gate.
Pathway to the courtyard.

3863.name: Servant's Quarters
description: This room is small!  You wonder how a person could live here at
all.  In fact, you are quite sure that this is even smaller
than you cousins dormitory room at college!  A small twin bed
sits in one corner.  The sheets look as if they haven't been
washed in ages.
Return to hallway.

3817.name: End of the Eastern Corridor
description: You have reached the end of this corridor.  To the north, there
is a closed door from behind which there are loud voices
booming.  Occasaionally, one voice becomes louder...then
laughter follows.
Into the Guards' Room.
Back towards the center of this level.

3880.name: Third Level of Camelot
description: As you reach the landing of the stairwell, you notice
immediately that this level is much more heavily guarded than
the others.  The lighting here is also much brighter than on
any of the other levels.
Down the Royal Corridor.
Back to the Second Level.

3889.name: Royal Corridor
description: This hallway is lined with murals depicting the achievements of
the famous King Arthur and his troops.  On either side of you
there are lifelike statues of armored knights.  These are the
suits of armor worn by the famous Knights of the Round
Table.
Down the Royal Corridor.
Down the Royal Corridor.

3812.name: End of the Western Corridor
description: You have reached the end of this corridor.  On either side, you
can see beautifully crafted doors.  From the room to the east,
you can hear idle chit-chat taking place.  From the room to the west--nothing.
Into a storage room.
Into the lounge.
Down the Western Corridor.

3835.name: Small Dungeon Cell
description: This cell seems almost burrowed into the stone, much like a
small cave.  The darkness makes it very difficult to see
anything in detail, though you can make out small shapes on the
ground.  Soft screaching sounds echo all around you, and you
can see small figures running about the dungeon floor.
Back into the hallway.

3870.name: Guest's Quarters
description: Though this room is by no means superbly furnished, it is
equipped with all the amenities one could ever need.  The bed
is covered with a beautiful, knitted comforter.  You can feel
that the blanket is still warm.
Back into the Hallway of Honor.

3862.name: Entrance to Servant Quarters
description: Here are three entrances to servant quarters.  The small rooms
are suitable for the commoners who inhabit them.  You wonder,
though, if you could possibly live in one comfortably.
Into a Servant's room.
Back towards the junction.
Into a Servant's room.
Into a Servant's room.

3872.name: Guest's Quarters
description: Though this room is by no means superbly furnished, it is
equipped with all the amenities one could ever need.  The bed
is covered with a beautiful, knitted comforter.  You can only
wonder how much effort must go into making such a fine quality
item.
Back into the Hallway of Honor.

3825.name: Kitchen
description: The kitchen is littered with dirty dishes and pots filled with
food.  Here is where all the meals for those who live in the
castle are made.  A servant boy hurries past you on an errand
to deliver a plate of something to one of the King's guests.
There is a small stairway leading up in the back of this room.
Into the Eastern Corridor.
Up to the second level of Camelot.

3855.name: Long Corridor
description: This long hallway leads down towards the guest quarters, as
well as the rooms the servants use.  The walls are adorned with
beautiful tapestries, donated but the wealthiest families
around.  All of them have pledged their allegiance to King Arthur.
Towards Lancelot's Suite.
Down the long corridor.

3885.name: Royal Corridor
description: This hallway is lined with murals depicting the achievements of
the famous King Arthur and his troops.  On either side of you
there are lifelike statues of armored knights.  These are the
suits of armor worn by the famous Knights of the Round
Table.
Down the Royal Corridor.
Down the Royal Corridor.

3858.name: Large Junction
description: >From here, the hallway contines in each of the cardinal
directions.  You can go north, back towards Lancelot's Suite
and the main stairwell, or you can contine south into the area
of the servants' quarters.  To the west, you can see another
spectacular suite, and to the east are the guest quarters.
Towards the servants' quarters.
Back towards Lancelot's room.
Towards the suite.
Towards the guest quarters.

3851.name: Short Hallway
description: The hallway here is adorned with beautiful paintings of those
who ruled the surrounding lands before King Arthur.  Like him,
each of these men have the air of importance and royalty about
them.  The pieces of artwork are supported by finely crafted
brass frames.
Down the short hallway.
Towards the main stairwell.

3850.name: Camelot's Second Level
description: You've reached the second floor of this wondrous castle.  The
stairway continues up even further, and it also goes back to
the main level.  The end of the hallway here is sparsely
decorated, though the stairwell has been carved out of stone
expertly.
Down the short hallway.
Up to the third floor.
Back to the main level.

3853.name: Beginning of the Long Corridor
description: You've reached some sort of a junction here.  A beautiful suite
lies to the north, while you can see another beautiful room way
to the south.  The main stairwell leading back to the main
floor lies to the east.  The light here is much brighter than
before, no doubt a result of the increased number of candles in
the area.
Down the long corridor.
Into a large suite.
Back towards the stairwell.

3822.name: East Corridor
description: The eastern corridor continues here.  To the south is a small foyer
area where sounds of raucious laughter can be heard.  To the east is
the main stairway.
To the end of the Northern Corridor.

3816.name: The Eastern Corridor
description: You continue down the eastern corridor of Camelot.  The floor
here is covered by a beautiful Persian carpet.  The thread is
of the finest quality and the design, you recognize, is that of
the crest of King Arthur.
Back towards the center of this level.
To the end of the hallway.

3807.name: In Front of the Castle Gate
description: The only thing stopping you from entering the castle now is a
large, closed gate directly in front of you.  On either side, a
young guard watches you closely for any actions that would
signal a hostile intent.  You can hear shouting from deep
inside the castle, though the content of the words is
unintelligible.
Entrance to Camelot.
A small pathway.

3810.name: Center of Camelot's First Level
description: You are at the center of all the comotion in this wondrous castle.
Around you, servants and guards move about their duties
religiously.  Each direction seems to look the same...
A corridor in Camelot.
A corridor in Camelot.
A corridor in Camelot.

3838.name: Small Dungeon Cell
description: This cell seems almost burrowed into the stone, much like a
small cave.  The darkness makes it very difficult to see
anything in detail, though you can make out small shapes on the
ground.  Soft screaching sounds echo all around you, and you
can see small figures running about the dungeon floor.
Back into the hallway.

3803.name: Beautiful Courtyard
description: The courtyard continues here.  It is clear that the
goundskeepers of Camelot take a great deal of pride in their
work.  The grass here looks as if it has been tended to
carefully.  Over to one side, you can see a beautiful pond.
Several ducklings are swimming there with their mother.  This
land seems very peaceful and serene.  Throughout the area there
are gorgeous rose gardens that permeate the air with a light
fragrance.
A walkway through the courtyard.

3866.name: Hallway of Honor
description: The hallway continues here towards the guest quarters and the
room of Sir Galahad, as well as back towards the Long
Corridor.  In addition, there is a room to the north.
Into a guest's quarters.
Back towards the junction.
Down the hallway.

3854.name: Lancelot's Private Suite
description: You've entered a beautiful room.  A large shaggy carpet covers
the tiled floor, and a beautiful painting of Lancelot's wife
hangs above the canopied bed.  The painting is bordered by a
brightly shining brass frame with rubies in the four corners.
Out of the suite.

3839.name: Small Dungeon Cell
description: This cell seems almost burrowed into the stone, much like a
small cave.  The darkness makes it very difficult to see
anything in detail, though you can make out small shapes on the
ground.  Soft screaching sounds echo all around you, and you
can see small figures running about the dungeon floor.
Back into the hallway.

3814.name: Storage Room
description: You've entered a small storage room.  Here the floor is covered
with old broken bits of gardening equipment, brooms and
assorted other items.
The Western Corridor.

3888.name: Turn in the Royal Corridor
description: Here the corridor veers east.  You can continue east, or return
to the stairwell by going north.
North down the Royal Corridor.
East down the Royal Corridor.

3860.name: Gawain's Quarters
description: Here you've entered the private room of Sir Gawain.  You
remember from your father that Sir Gawain single-handedly
killed several five-headed dragons who were attacking Camelot.
Gawain's room is decorated with silk covering the walls,
flowers on the end table, and a large portrait of himself on
the wall.
Out of the suite.

3813.name: Lounge
description: You've entered the servants' lounge.  Here is where they eat
their meals, visit with eachother, and tell tales of all they
have seen on the levels above.  On the second and third floors
Knights of the Round Table and King Arthur make their
residence.
The Western Corridor.

3808.name: Inside Camelot
description: You are just inside the castle gate of Camelot.  From here, you
can hear the hum of activity from all directions.  Servants are hurrying about
their duties.  The hallway here is lit by sparse light from
candles on either side of you.
Down the corridor.
Out the castle gate.

3840.name: a royal guard~
description: A strong man watches for any sign of disobediance to his Highness, the King.  He stands perfectly straight; only his eyes move, following you closely.  His diligence to his duties is a tribute to his master's skill as a leader.

3810.name: a royal chef~
description: You see a man working feverishly to prepare dinner for His Lord, King Arthur of Camelot.
3810.room_name: An elderly chef chops onions here.

3844.name: Sir Gawain~
description:
You see the galant Sir Gawain smile as he draws his weapon...it's been
awhile since someone dared enter his private room without his consent.
Since he fell from Arthur's favor some years back, Gawain has spent his
time here, in this room, writing of his adventures.  No doubt this piece
of work would be interesting; perhaps he'll include the tale of your death
in it.
3844.room_name: A strong man in shining armor.

3846.name: Sir Galahad~
description:
Here Sir Galahad sits in his pristine armor.  It would seem the rumors of
his death were, indeed, greatly exaggerated.  After defeating the vicious
swarm of enemies from the south, Galahad returned to Camelot to train the
land's best men to serve the crown.
3846.room_name: The courageous Sir Galahad stands here.

3848.name: a travelling monk~
description:
A friend of King Arthur's, Archbishop Turpin, relaxes here and waits for
his meal.  Turpin has been close friends with Arthur since before hi
entered the seminary.  This friendship has benefited both men:  Turpin's
church coffers have grown, and Arthur has received the benefit of divine
intervention when necessary.
3848.room_name: An elderly man of the cloth awaits dinner.

3842.name: Sir Lancelot~
description:
You see Sir Lancelot in his full armor, as he rises to meet you.  He has
been honored many times by his ruler, King Arthur, for his loyalty to the
crown.  His victories are well known throughout the land, especially one
important fact:  Lancelot has never lost a hand to hand duel.
3842.room_name: A strong man in shining armor.

3822.name: a prisoner~
description: You see a weary man with a scraggly beard leaning up against the stone wall.  His face is gaunt and his legs have withered some from the lack of proper nurishment.
3822.room_name: An enemy of the King rests here in shackles.

3821.name: a prisoner~
description: You see a weary woman leaning up against the stone wall.  Her hair is scraggly and she looks gaunt and weak.
3821.room_name: An enemy of the King rests here in shackles.

3860.name: a knight in shining armor~
description:
You see a tall man dressed in the finest, most ornate armor you have ever
seen.  He seems ready to sacrifice his life for the gentle ruler of this
land.  The skill of those selected to serve King Arthur in such an important
place--Camelot--is widely known and feared.
3860.room_name: A courageous knight stands ready to defend his master.

3865.name: the great Merlin~
description:
You look up and see Merlin mixing some liquids on his workbench.  He works
intently for a minute or so, then slowly raises his gaze to meet yours.  He
stops working on his project, wipes his hands, and moves to confront you.
The Great Merlin has dispatched many young adventurers to the after-life;
perhaps you will be among those "lucky" few.
3865.room_name: The powerful Merlin stands working on a potion of some type.

3802.name: a Royal Groundskeeper~
description: An older man is working here to keep the grounds of Camelot looking beautiful.
3802.room_name: A man works here on the lawn.

3805.name: a castle guard~
description: A well-armored man watches over those who enter and pass through his master's residence.  The man looks upon you with a suspicious gaze; he has learned through experience that adventurers are often troublesome travellers.
3805.room_name: A young man stands here defending Camelot from intruders.

3870.name: King Arthur~
description:
You are truly impressed by the presence this man commands.  Standing
before him, you are awed by his grandiose appearance and firm stance.
You can recall all the tales your father told you about this kind, gentle
man.  At the sight of his enormous sword, the legendary Excalibur, the
stories of a weak, old ruler quickly pass from your mind.
3870.room_name: The imposing figure of King Arthur awaits you in the center of the room.

3807.name: a young servant boy~
description: You see a young lad hurrying to deliver a message to his master.  His eyes dart around as he keeps an eye on you and his surroundings.
3807.room_name: A young boy attends to his duties.
